PageSwapEvent.summary: The PageSwapEvent event object is made available inside handler functions for the event.

remarks.para: The pageswap event is fired when you navigate across documents, when the previous document is about to unload. During a cross-document navigation, the PageSwapEvent event object allows you to manipulate the related view transition (providing access to the relevant object) from the document being navigated from, if a view transition was triggered by the navigation. It also provides access to information on the navigation type and current and destination documents.

PageSwapEventActivation.summary: The activation read-only property of the interface contains a object containing the navigation type and current and destination document history entries for a same-origin navigation.
PageSwapEventActivation.value: A object, or null if the associated navigation has a cross-origin URL anywhere in the redirect chain.

PageSwapEventPageSwapEvent.summary:
The PageSwapEvent() constructor creates a new
object instance.

PageSwapEventViewTransition.summary: The viewTransition read-only property of the interface contains a object representing the active view transition for the cross-document navigation.
PageSwapEventViewTransition.value: A object, or null if no view transition is active when the event is fired.
